title: Agentic Workflows Assessment
description: Assessment covering task delegation, multi-agent coordination, autonomous operation patterns, and efficient workflow design in Claude Code.

questions.questionText: When should you use the Task tool to spawn a subagent instead of doing work directly?
options: For any task that takes more than one tool call
For complex multi-step tasks or open-ended exploration
Always - subagents are more efficient
Never - direct tool calls are always better
questions.correctAnswer: For complex multi-step tasks or open-ended exploration
questions.explanation: Task tool is for complex tasks requiring multiple rounds of exploration. Simple tasks should use direct tool calls.

source.title: Claude Code Subagents Reference
source.section: Choose between subagents and main conversation

correctAnswer.quotedText: Use subagents when: The task produces verbose output you don't need in your main context. You want to enforce specific tool restrictions or permissions. The work is self-contained and can return a summary.

questions.questionText: What is the key benefit of running multiple Task tool calls in parallel?
options: Reduces token usage
Maximizes efficiency by concurrent execution
Makes the output cleaner
Avoids context pollution
questions.explanation: When tasks are independent, running them in parallel completes work faster than sequential execution.

correctAnswer.quotedText: For independent investigations, spawn multiple subagents to work simultaneously. Each subagent explores its area independently, then Claude synthesizes the findings.

questions.questionText: When spawning an Explore agent, what should your prompt include?
options: Just the file path to look at
The question to answer and thoroughness level (quick/medium/thorough)
A complete list of all files to read
The expected answer format
questions.correctAnswer: The question to answer and thoroughness level (quick/medium/thorough)
questions.explanation: Explore agents need clear questions and thoroughness guidance to search effectively.

correctAnswer.quotedText: When invoking Explore, Claude specifies a thoroughness level: quick for targeted lookups, medium for balanced exploration, or very thorough for comprehensive analysis.

questions.questionText: What is the TodoWrite tool primarily used for?
options: Creating permanent project documentation
Tracking task progress and planning complex multi-step work
Sending notifications to the user
Logging errors and warnings
questions.correctAnswer: Tracking task progress and planning complex multi-step work
questions.explanation: TodoWrite helps track progress on complex tasks and provides visibility to users on what's being done.

correctAnswer.quotedText: Use this tool to create a structured task list for your current coding session. This helps you track progress, organize complex tasks, and demonstrate thoroughness to the user.

questions.questionText: When should you mark a todo as 'in_progress'?
options: When you add it to the list
After completing the previous task
Before beginning work on that task
Only when the user asks about progress
questions.correctAnswer: Before beginning work on that task
questions.explanation: Mark tasks in_progress BEFORE starting. This gives users real-time visibility into current work.

correctAnswer.quotedText: When you start working on a task - Mark it as in_progress BEFORE beginning work.

questions.questionText: How many todos should be 'in_progress' at any given time?
options: One per subagent spawned (multiply by agent count)
Exactly one
Zero until the final task is ready
Up to three for complex workflows
questions.explanation: Only ONE task should be in_progress at a time. Complete current tasks before starting new ones.

correctAnswer.quotedText: Status progresses: `pending` → `in_progress` → `completed`. Mark task as in progress when starting work.

questions.questionText: When a user asks you to implement a non-trivial feature, what tool should you consider using first?
options: Write tool to start coding immediately
EnterPlanMode to design the approach first
Task tool to spawn multiple agents
Read tool to look at existing code
questions.correctAnswer: EnterPlanMode to design the approach first
questions.explanation: For non-trivial implementations, planning first prevents wasted effort and ensures alignment with user expectations.

correctAnswer.quotedText: Use this tool proactively when you're about to start a non-trivial implementation task. Getting user sign-off on your approach before writing code prevents wasted effort and ensures alignment.

questions.questionText: What happens when you use AskUserQuestion tool?
options: The conversation pauses until the user responds
A background process waits for input
The question is logged for later review
Multiple questions are batched together
questions.correctAnswer: The conversation pauses until the user responds
questions.explanation: AskUserQuestion is synchronous - use it when you need clarification before proceeding.

correctAnswer.quotedText: Use this tool when you need to ask the user questions during execution. This allows you to: Gather user preferences or requirements, Clarify ambiguous instructions, Get decisions on implementation choices as you work.

questions.questionText: When should you NOT use the TodoWrite tool?
options: For complex multi-step tasks
When the user provides multiple requirements
For a single, straightforward task that takes one step
When planning implementation strategy
questions.correctAnswer: For a single, straightforward task that takes one step
questions.explanation: Skip TodoWrite for trivial single-step tasks. Just do the work directly.

source.title: Claude Code CLI Reference
source.section: TaskCreate tool - When NOT to Use

correctAnswer.quotedText: When NOT to Use This Tool: Skip using this tool when there is only a single, straightforward task. The task is trivial and tracking it provides no organizational benefit.

questions.questionText: What is the correct approach when you encounter an error during task execution?
options: Create a new task for error investigation, mark original complete
Keep the task in_progress, investigate and fix the error
Roll back changes and restart the task from scratch
Immediately escalate to the user before any investigation
questions.correctAnswer: Keep the task in_progress, investigate and fix the error
questions.explanation: Never mark tasks complete if errors occurred. Keep in_progress while investigating and fixing.

correctAnswer.quotedText: ONLY mark a task as completed when you have FULLY accomplished it. If you encounter errors, blockers, or cannot finish, keep the task as in_progress.
